result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall attend the Alternatives to Aggression seminar on May 16, 2015.  Proof of attendance must be provided to the District Attorney's Office.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the State's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction on this charge for a period of one year.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the State will move to dismiss Count 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steve J. Schueller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steve J. Schueller in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.   Plea of no contest to count 2 - disorderly conduct - domestic.   Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.    Court dismisses and read in  Count 1.   Court orders deferred agreement for one year on count 2 with standard conditions and must attend the alternatives to aggression program; upon successful completion of the deferred agreement, count 2 will be dismissed.  - rt
to modify bond for DE to travel to Minnesota and Michigan for work purposes - granted
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Steve J. Schueller in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to charge.  Court orders $500.00 cash bond with booking.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.  - rt
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
